p: The results showed that different concentrations of three methanolic extracts and Glucantime® decreased the growth rate of amastigotes (clinical stage). Our plant extracts demonstrated significant reduction in the mean number of amastigotes in cells compared to untreated control at all concentrations, except at 1 μg/mL ( P ≤ 0.01). Besides, Q. velutina represented more reducing effect on the amastigotes in comparison to the other extracts and Glucantim®e, especially at 1000 μg/mL concentrations ( P ≤ 0.01) ( Fig. 3, Table 2). Also, the IC 50 value for Q. velutina was 51.2 μg/mL, followed by C. procera 95.2 μg/mL and N. tabacum 118.3 μg/mL against amastigotes, whereas this value was 236.3 μg/mL for Glucantime® as control drug ( Table 1). All extracts showed significant reduction in the IC 50 value of amastigotes compared to Glucantime® ( P ≤ 0.001), as Q. velutina showed the lowest one.
